reference.title: Terraform Variables
reference.shortdesc: You must configure a number of Terraform variables in order to create a cluster. You can configure the values of these variables in your tfvars file using the overrides.tfvars.sample file included with as an example.

desc.note: All values are required. Except for dea_count, specify all variable values in quotation marks. These values are case-sensitive.

row.entry: Variable
Description
Notes
The initial username for your cluster
The initial password for your cluster
The number of Droplet Execution Agent (DEA) hosts that you want to create
The DNS server of your local environment
This is a -only variable.The default value is 8.8.8.8. If your local environment does not have a DNS server, remove this variable.
The address of your HTTP proxy
This is a -only variable.If you do not use a proxy, leave the value blank.
The address of your HTTPS proxy
This is a -only variable.If you do not use a proxy, leave the value blank.
The location and name of the private key pem file associated with your key pair, relative to your tfvars file.
For convenience, you can place the pem and tfvarsfiles into the same directory.
The addresses for which a proxy should not be used
The unique regional location on which the deployment is launched

ul.li: The default value for is nova.
The default value for is az1.

row.entry: The ID of your Ubuntu 14.04.3 cloud image
This is a -only variable.To determine the ID of the base image, run the nova image-list command.
The OpenStack flavor, a virtual hardware template that defines the specifications of the specified node

These are -only variables.
4 (larger than or equals to 8 GB)
3 (larger than or equals to 4 GB) For more information about flavors, see the OpenStack documentation. For more information on managing compute flavors, see the Helion OpenStack documentation.
The external network from whose subnet floating IP addresses are allocated
This is a -only variable.The default value is ext-net.
The name of your key pair
The network ID
To determine the network ID , run the neutron net-list command.
The name of your network
The region of your tenant
This is a -only variable.The default value is us-east

example.title: A sample .tfvars file for
example.codeblock:
openstack_base_image_id = "123ab3cd-1a23-1a23-ab12-1234a567b890"
openstack_flavor_id.core = "4" openstack_flavor_id.dea = "3"
openstack_availability_zone = "nova" openstack_keypair = "myKeyPair" openstack_network_id = "123a1ab1-12a1-123a-1a12-a1234a123a12" openstack_network_name = "myNetwork" openstack_floating_ip_pool = "ext-net" dns_server = "203.0.113.0" key_file = "myKeyFile.pem"
cluster_admin_username = "myClusterUsername" cluster_admin_password = "myClusterPassword123"
dea_count = 1
http_proxy = "http://myProxy.example.com:8080" https_proxy = "https://myProxy.example.com:443"
no_proxy = "198.51.100.0,.example.com"

example.title: A sample .tfvars file
example.codeblock: openstack_availability_zone = "az1" openstack_keypair = "myKeyPair" openstack_network_id = "123a1ab1-12a1-123a-1a12-a1234a123a12" openstack_network_name = "myNetwork" openstack_region = "us-west" cluster_admin_username = "myClusterUsername" cluster_admin_password = "myClusterPassword123" key_file = "myKeyFile.pem" dea_count = 1
